I wish to express my deep concern at the increased loss to the United Kingdom of historic ships, especially those from the West Country, from  sale abroad or rot and rust.  Will he  initiate a process to  give  historic ships the same  legal protection as historic buildings. If historic ships must be licensed for sale abroad, ensure  the licence includes conditions that ensure continued appearance at UK festivals at intervals.

Summer maritime festivals, which are free and attract  200,000 people a year in Bristol alone, are the most direct opportunity to improve awareness. The loss of sponsorship has seen the number of ships on show drop sharply. I ask Ministers to ensure the Lottery sets up a substantial “appearance and interpretation   fund”   which would support appearances at these harbour festivals, as in the splendid Jubilee parade. It would deepen public  understanding  through much improved presentations of the history of the ships.
